content:
I have a question for you all: I’m in the process of trying to ensure that every (*) issue that is labelled both T-compiler and P-high has some kind of “owner” attached to it. The owner is preferably a WG of some sort, though I guess a project group is also fine. An individual owner is acceptable though I think it is a little more concerned due to “bus factor”.

(*) Or at least “almost every"
The very first issue I found was #52652 . I assume all progress in the #[unwind(allowed)] space is owned by you all.

the obvious answer is for me to create a project group label for you all (e.g. PG-ffi-unwind, analogous to the existing PG-error-handing and PG-portable-simd), but that label isn’t actually meaningful unless you all are planning to keep track of things with that tag.
an alternative to creating a label would be to simply assign @BatmanAoD (Kyle Strand) as the owner of the issue.

@pnkfelix I assume I can configure Git to automatically watch issues with the PG-ffi-unwind label, once you create it? If so, that would work fine. Otherwise, it may be best to just keep me as an explicit assignee for now.
